trespass.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to go onto someone’s private land without their permission
trespass.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She was arrested for trespassing on government property.
trespass.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission
trespass.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
trespass.translation[1].definitions[1].d: something you have done that is morally wrong
trespass.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to go onto someone’s land or into their property without their permission
trespass.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Union organizers had trespassed on company premises to try and recruit new members.
